content:
• Tuesday, July 3, 2012
  • PCXCQ

    Coal company shares soared today, perhaps thanks to a Bloomberg report describing Europe's...

    Coal company shares soared today, perhaps thanks to a Bloomberg report describing Europe's exploding demand for coal despite tough EU restrictions on carbon emissions. Coal is now more competitive to burn in Europe than gas, and more of Europe's coal may come from the U.S. PCX +33.3%, ANR +6.4%, BTU +5.4%, ACI +3.8%, JRCC +9.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 7 Comments

  • Market recap: Shares end higher in today's shortened session ahead of the Independence Day...

    Market recap: Shares end higher in today's shortened session ahead of the Independence Day holiday, helped by stronger-than-expected factory orders and a rise in energy shares, which were boosted by a rally in oil due to renewed tension with Iran. However, consumer discretionary stocks were hurt by a fall in Redbook chain-store sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM
  • GRPN

    Groupon (GRPN -7.6%) fell hard for the second straight day as the Street digests chairman Eric...

    Groupon (GRPN -7.6%) fell hard for the second straight day as the Street digests chairman Eric Lefkofsky's plans to take a reduced role, thus leaving controversial CEO Andrew Mason more firmly in control. Bulls looking for a bit of good news might want to check out a comScore study that suggests Groupon is proving popular with European women: it estimates over 14M visited Groupon's site in May.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • DRC

    Dresser-Rand (DRC +4.7%) purchases all patents, trademarks and other intellectual property...

    Dresser-Rand (DRC +4.7%) purchases all patents, trademarks and other intellectual property associated with compressed air energy storage technology developed by Energy Storage and Power and Dr. Michael Nakhamkin. DRC says the acquisition expands the range of its compressed air energy storage offerings.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +6.3%) surges thanks to a bullish note from Citi's Mark Mahaney, who points out...

    Netflix (NFLX +6.3%) surges thanks to a bullish note from Citi's Mark Mahaney, who points out the company now trades at a valuation of just 12x the earnings of its domestic ops (ed: the international business is losing money, and including it would produce a higher multiple). Mahaney also claims recent customer surveys reflect favorably on Netflix. 26% of Netflix's float was shorted as of June 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • OSUR

    OraSure (OSUR +6%) resumes trading after announcing the FDA has approved its OraQuick in-home...

    OraSure (OSUR +6%) resumes trading after announcing the FDA has approved its OraQuick in-home HIV test, a home-use HIV test kit that does not require sending a sample to a laboratory for analysis. The kit - the first of its kind ever cleared by the FDA - will be for sale in stores and online to anyone age 17 and older.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake (CHK +3%) attracts a new activist, as CHK reportedly is now the fourth largest...

    Chesapeake (CHK +3%) attracts a new activist, as CHK reportedly is now the fourth largest position held by the Third Point hedge fund. But while Carl Icahn has been quietly acting behind the scenes and voices respect for Aubrey McClendon, Dan Loeb may not be as nice.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZN

    Shares of Zion Oil & Gas (ZN +9.6%) surge on news the Israel-based exploration company will...

    Shares of Zion Oil & Gas (ZN +9.6%) surge on news the Israel-based exploration company will re-enter the Elijah #3 well in Northern Israel.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • HUN

    Huntsman (HUN +3.9%) agrees to buy full ownership of Huntsman NMG, its Russian joint venture...

    Huntsman (HUN +3.9%) agrees to buy full ownership of Huntsman NMG, its Russian joint venture with NMG, a major supplier of polyurethane systems to the adhesives, coatings and footwear markets in Russia, Ukraine and Belarus.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +5.6%), which had 50.2% of its float shorted as of June 15, is catching a...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +5.6%), which had 50.2% of its float shorted as of June 15, is catching a bid thanks to positive comments from Piper's Andrew Nowinski. Nowinski's checks indicate OCZ is seeing higher demand for its solid-state drives (SSDs), and is involved in many deals related to Microsoft's Azure cloud infrastructure  platform. He adds diving NAND flash memory prices are boosting OCZ's sales of higher-capacity SSDs.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM
  • ATVI

    Confirming earlier speculation, Activision (ATVI +3.7%) announces it's partnering with Chinese...

    Confirming earlier speculation, Activision (ATVI +3.7%) announces it's partnering with Chinese Internet messaging and gaming giant Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY) to bring an online version of Call of Duty to Chinese gamers. The game will be free to play, and monetized via virtual goods purchases. Rival Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) is teaming up with Tencent to bring The Sims Social to China. (yesterday)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTR

    Ag sector stocks are trading strong on the heels of yesterday's USDA crop progress report that...

    Ag sector stocks are trading strong on the heels of yesterday's USDA crop progress report that showed worsening conditions in corn and soybeans, citing hot and dry weather across the U.S. Also possibly helping is National Bank's upgrade (I, II) on shares of Potash (POT +2.1%) and Agrium (AGU +3.3%). Also: MOS +2.3%, CF +3.1%, IPI +3.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • SYT

    The EPA grants registration approval for Syngenta's (SYT +2.6%) two refuge-in-a-bag corn seed...

    The EPA grants registration approval for Syngenta's (SYT +2.6%) two refuge-in-a-bag corn seed products, making them available for the 2013 planting season. "The launch of a refuge-in-a-bag offer further enhances our leading corn insect control portfolio, which includes seed treatments and insecticides as well as traits," SYT says.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • RIC

    Richmont Mines (RIC -17.8%) announces a downward revision of reserves and production and says it...

    Richmont Mines (RIC -17.8%) announces a downward revision of reserves and production and says it will take a Q2 writedown of C$25M-C$30M pre-tax related to lower anticipated production from its Francoeur Mine.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 2 Comments
  • NUAN

    Nuance (NUAN +2.2%) trades higher following the purchase of rival clinical transcription/voice...

    Nuance (NUAN +2.2%) trades higher following the purchase of rival clinical transcription/voice recognition solutions provider M*Modal (NASDAQ:MODL) by JPMorgan's P-E arm. Deutsche (Buy) notes the deal's valuation (2x estimated FY13 sales) is in-line with the that paid by Nuance for recent acquisitions, and thinks it's evidence P-E firms are "becoming more active" in the medical transcription and records space.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • RA-OLD

    RailAmerica (RA-OLD +4.6%) has attracted takeover interest from rival transportation companies...

    RailAmerica (RA-OLD +4.6%) has attracted takeover interest from rival transportation companies Genesee & Wyoming (GWR +0.8%) and Watco, as well as several funds, Reuters reports. In May, RA said it hired Deutsche Bank to evaluate strategic options. Fortress Investment Group (FIG +0.3%) holds a 60% stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM | 1 Comment
  • SLS

    Shares of Galena Biopharma (GALE -6.2%) trade lower this morning after the company filed late...

    Shares of Galena Biopharma (GALE -6.2%) trade lower this morning after the company filed late yesterday to sell 2.5M shares on behalf of selling shareholders.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 4 Comments
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) +9.3%, although there's no obvious news that's could have...

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) +9.3%, although there's no obvious news that's could have triggered the spike. The message boards on Yahoo Finance speculate that the jump could be due to insider buying, while Five Star Equities seems to finger Keryx as a possible acquisition target as Big Pharma looks to replace expiring patents.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +5.1%) breaks out of a tight trading range to see $22 for...

    Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR +5.1%) breaks out of a tight trading range to see $22 for the first time in a few weeks. Without any corporate news out of note, traders are pointing to technical factors for the mini-rally. The bear camp isn't taking the pressure off though after eagle-eyed GMCR watchers call out that the company dropped their Amazon prices on Vue Brewers only a few weeks after CEO Larry Blanford publicly stated prices could increase for the product.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 2 Comments
  • MIPS

    MIPS (MIPS -2.1%) trades lower after reaching a patent licensing deal with Broadcom (BRCM...

    MIPS (MIPS -2.1%) trades lower after reaching a patent licensing deal with Broadcom (BRCM +0.6%). In exchange for $26.5M plus "other consideration," Broadcom obtains a non-exclusive license for the use of MIPS' IP in its products. In addition, Broadcom, which has long used MIPS' CPU cores in its set-top box processors, is taking out a multi-year extension for its license to use MIPS' cores. Activist fund Starboard Value has been pushing MIPS to better monetize its patents.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA +2.9%) receives the latest of several warnings on guidance, as Dahlman Rose cuts its...

    Alcoa (AA +2.9%) receives the latest of several warnings on guidance, as Dahlman Rose cuts its Q2 earnings estimates from $0.07/share on $640M in revenue to $0.03/share on revenue of $550M, citing weak aluminum prices. But the firm maintains its Buy rating and $14.65 price target, which suggests 70% upside to the stock’s Monday closing price of $8.63.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM | 1 Comment
  • X

    U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) shares +4.3% in what seems like somewhat of a delayed reaction - if indeed...

    U.S. Steel (NYSE:X) shares +4.3% in what seems like somewhat of a delayed reaction - if indeed it is that - to the appointment yesterday of Mario Longhi as COO to replace John Goodish, who retired in late 2010. Shares have climbed 14% over the past month, but are still down over 50% since July 2011.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • ADTN

    In addition to downgrading Research In Motion to Underweight, Barclays is lowering Adtran (ADTN...

    In addition to downgrading Research In Motion to Underweight, Barclays is lowering Adtran (ADTN -1.7%) and InterDigital (IDCC -1.5%) to Equal Weight. On the flip side, NetGear (NTGR +4.4%) has been upgraded to Overweight.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • LDK

    Some solar names are rallying after the Chinese government quadruples its 2015 domestic solar...

    Some solar names are rallying after the Chinese government quadruples its 2015 domestic solar installation target to 21GW - its latest effort (previous) to prop up local vendors contending with oversupply, negative gross margins, weak Euro demand, and now anti-dumping tariffs. Remaining to be seen is how much the government will "encourage" local firms to consolidate. LDK +5.9%. STP +6.8%. FSLR +4.8%. CSIQ +4.7%. JASO +3.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • HD

    Shares of Home Depot (HD -3.1%) and Lowe's (LOW -3.5%) drop hard in early trading as investors...

    Shares of Home Depot (HD -3.1%) and Lowe's (LOW -3.5%) drop hard in early trading as investors jump off of select retail stocks with lower forecasts out from ISCS on June comparable-store sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • VRS

    Verso Paper (VRS +72.6%) says it’s held discussions about a potential business combination...

    Verso Paper (VRS +72.6%) says it’s held discussions about a potential business combination involving NewPage Corp. in a proposed transaction valued at more than $1.43B. Bankrupt NewPage says its 2011 net sales totaled $3.5B; it owns paper mills in six states with combined production capacity of ~3.5M tons/year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:19 AM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU +3.3%) once more issues a PR rejecting the allegations made by a report...

    Qihoo 360 (QIHU +3.3%) once more issues a PR rejecting the allegations made by a report questioning its web traffic stats. The company claims it removed code used by comScore to track its traffic - the heart of hacker collective Anonymous' complaint - because an anti-virus program mistook it for a Trojan, and quotes comScore as stating it's still working with Qihoo.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • CF

    Standard & Poor's boosts CF Industries (CF +1.3%) into investment-grade territory, raising...

    Standard & Poor's boosts CF Industries (CF +1.3%) into investment-grade territory, raising its corporate credit rating to BBB- from BB+, citing the fertilizer producer's recent operating performance and leverage-related metrics. S&P expects operating performance to remain strong relative to historical levels despite weakening from 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere (NASDAQ:NSPH) soars 19.1% into the stratosphere and hits $3.02 as Jefferies upgrades...

    Nanosphere (NASDAQ:NSPH) soars 19.1% into the stratosphere and hits $3.02 as Jefferies upgrades the company to buy from hold. Jefferies expects the firm's bloodstream infection test, which the FDA approved last week, to "drive a significant acceleration in new system placements and revenue." Jefferies also ups NSPH's price target to $5/share from $2.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) -51.4% premarket after the drug developer is notified by the...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) -51.4% premarket after the drug developer is notified by the FDA that data from the continuing study of its Northera low-blood-pressure medication, the company's lead drug candidate, is unlikely to provide enough evidence to support marketing approval for the treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • FSM

    Fortuna Silver Mines (NYSE:FSM) +3.2% premarket after the company says it discovered high-grade...

    Fortuna Silver Mines (NYSE:FSM) +3.2% premarket after the company says it discovered high-grade gold and silver mineralization at the Tlacolula project in Mexico. FSM says the discovery marks a “significant benchmark” in its exploration program.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures poke through into the green a bit of ahead of America's 236th...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures poke through into the green a bit of ahead of America's 236th birthday tomorrow, with the S&P benchmark slightly higher. It's a short session today and volumes will probably be light, but factory orders could poop the party if they disappoint. Barclays +1.9% after Bob Diamond quits, while Microsoft is -1.2% as investors shrug off a $6.2B writedown. Ongoing: Auto sales
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • NSPH

    Premarket gainers: NSPH +17%. MODL +9%. CNSL +7%. ATPG +6%. Losers: CHTP -52%. OSIR -7%.

    Premarket gainers: NSPH +17%. MODL +9%. CNSL +7%. ATPG +6%.
    Losers: CHTP -52%. OSIR -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • EEP

    Enbridge Energy Partners (NYSE:EEP) -2% premarket after revising its estimates for full-year...

    Enbridge Energy Partners (NYSE:EEP) -2% premarket after revising its estimates for full-year adjusted net income to $440M-$470M on adjusted EBITDA of $1.12B-$1.17B. EEP says it will reduce capital investment into the natural gas business in the near term, but maintains its 2%-5% annual distribution growth target.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM
  • GMXRQ

    GMX Resources (GMXR) +10.4% premarket after announcing the spudding of an eighth Bakken well in...

    GMX Resources (GMXR) +10.4% premarket after announcing the spudding of an eighth Bakken well in North Dakota. GMXR has a 50% working interest in the Basaraba 24-35-1H, with a proposed total depth of 20,950 ft. and proposed total vertical depth of 11,221 ft. The well was spud with an Helmerich & Payne (NYSE:HP) FlexRig 3.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • OSIR

    The Street's Adam Feuerstein accuses Osiris Therapeutics of (NASDAQ:OSIR) misleading investors...

    The Street's Adam Feuerstein accuses Osiris Therapeutics of (NASDAQ:OSIR) misleading investors about the results from a Phase II trial of its stem-cell treatment Prochymal in heart-attack patients. "The company claimed the study was a success. That's not true," Feuerstein declares. "Figuring out Osiris' deception wasn't that difficult." Shares -5.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 AM
  • DUK

    Duke Energy (NYSE:DUK) closes its acquisition of Progress Energy (PGN) but surprisingly names...

    Duke Energy (NYSE:DUK) closes its acquisition of Progress Energy (PGN) but surprisingly names Jim Rogers as CEO and Chairman of the combined company. The plan had been for Progress CEO Bill Johnson to lead the new firm, with Rogers as executive chairman, but Johnson has left. Duke shares +192% premarket following a 1-for-3 reverse stock split. (PR) (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:21 AM | 8 Comments
  • SDRL

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) says its Seadrill Partners subsidiary has filed for an IPO. On completion...

    Seadrill (NYSE:SDRL) says its Seadrill Partners subsidiary has filed for an IPO. On completion of the offering, Seadrill Partners is expected to have an interest in two semi-submersible drilling rigs, one drillship and one semi-tender rig from SDRL's rig fleet. SDRL +2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM | 2 Comments
